data.title: Sadly closed...
data.text: My favorite local spot is closed... Hoping that something as friendly and fun will come into the space.  Thanks Bobbi and Craig for the fun times over the last few years.  See you around!

data.title: A Mixed Bag
data.text:
I want to love Two Twelve but I have mixed feelings!  On the food side, let me tell you the chef really knows what he is doing.  The food is very good.  I haven't made it in to try the prime rib but I'd love to.  The menu is generally comfort food and who doesn't love comfort food!

On the bar side, meh ... and its primarily a bar setting (think high pub tables).  Every time I've gone, the drinks came out v-e-r-y   s-l-o-w-l-y, and they were always under staffed in my opinion.  

I think they do have some seating in the side room but every time I've gone they had something weird going on  (tango dancing, game night)?  I'm sure it's just my timing so don't let this hold you back. I know they regularly have live music and I would love to go sometime and hear the music.

But I don't go ... I just have generally better restaurants with much easier parking to go to in my rotation of dining out.  If your in the area, though, you really should try the food.

data.title: Great service!
data.text: Hosted a friend's bachelorette dinner at 212 and was very pleased with the service. I was a bit nervous making reservations for 15+, but they assured me it wouldn't be a problem. We arrived and had a table ready without wait. The owner was out and about making sure everyone was enjoying their meals (which were delicious and well priced), and the overall atmosphere was just great.

data.title: A gem in downtown Kirkland!
data.text: Two Twelve is a gem!  The food is great and the service is friendly.  Entrees are tasty and we have especially enjoyed their Happy Hour with good drinks and flavorful appetizers at appealing prices.  The crispy sweet-potato fries are a stand-out and, you wouldn’t thing you’d like it, but the fried Brussels sprouts are light and delicious.  The place has a fun small-bistro vibe with music in the evening.  We have returned several times with friends and always been pleased.

data.title: Fabulous night out with friends - food, drink, service, music!
data.text:
For a great night out with adults - excellent hors d'oeuvres menu selection that includes old standards and some outstanding unique dishes (try the fried brussel sprouts - really! - and chili lime prawns), friendly and attentive service, great drinks, and a side of fab live music in an intimate locale - Two Twelve on Central is a genuine find in Kirkland.  

We made reservations for our party of 20 - were seated comfortably in the separate half of the restaurant, where the manager went out of her way to arrange seating to accommodate our wishes.  Drinks and food service was prompt and excellent quality fare.  And, we even had a special a cappella visit from the evening's jazz performer for our group. 

Would recommend Two Twelve for a small gathering of adult friends for post-dinner evening get together or, with a bit of advanced arranging, a large group is given a great reception as well.  We'll definitely be back.
